Description: The Department of Justice reached 70 settlements involving 457 hospitals in 43 states for more than $250 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.

Advocate Health and Hospitals Corporation entered into a $317,660.89 settlement agreement to resolve allegations that Advocate employed two individuals who were excluded from participation in any Federal health care program.
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General

Company: Advocate Health Hospital Corp. d/b/a Advocate Lutheran General Hospital
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: The Department of Justice announced that it  reached settlements with 51 hospitals in 15 states for more than $23 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.
Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Private Litigation Case Title: Lukas v. Advocate Health Care Network And Subsidiaries, an Illinois Non-Profit Corporation et al
Brabazon v. Aurora Health Care Inc

Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office for Civil Rights

Private Litigation Case Title: Magpayo v. Advocate Health Care Network

Description: To settle a lawsuit alleging that it improperly denied ERISA protections to participants in its pension plan by claiming it was an exempt church plan, Advocate agreed to pay $300 each to class members and $1.25 million to plaintiff's counsel. The court documents do not estimate what the total cost of the payments to the class members would be.
Private Litigation Case Title: Stapleton et al v. Advocate Health Care Network and subsidiaries et al
